intro: Phaeomeria moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan phaeomeria, is a flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant is herbaceous, with slender stems and narrow, lanceolate leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
